Great sushi and affordable for 4. Fresh fish and the yellowtail cheek was perfect.  Great service and highly recommended.

I really really really really like this place.  It is tiny - 4 tables and 8 sushi bar spots.    The Sushi chef is Japanese.  It seems to be a family run place.  Excellent service - a convivial establishment.  They had a buy a Saporo and get a free sake deal - you can't argue with that!  We had monkey brain appetizer, firecracker roll, spicey tuna and a tiger eye.  The tiger eye is tuna and avocado wrapped in squid - it was expertly prepared.  It doesn't have a sushi restaurant feel though - it looks more like a sandwich spot - but that is only a side note.  The prices were reasonable.  This really is a nice little neighborhood spot with quality food and a friendly atmosphere.  I will go back when I am the green valley area.

We tried this for the first time after several neighbors recommended.  To be honest, we we are bit disappointed after reading all the wonderful reviews.  The service was excellent, and everyone was very friendly, but to be honest the sushi was just that not great.  Not bad by any means, but just very average.  For the money, it was fine, but we tried 4-5 rolls, and we felt it was very similar to others with this price point.   Not really a restaurant we would return to.

Efficient and friendly service, excellent lunch specials, sushi was fresh and delicious. Recommend the Tarantula roll, and their California roll was best I've ever had (simple roll, excellently prepared).

3.5 stars. Went here for lunch with a good friend who loves sushi. Got there just as it opened and were warmly greeted and seated. Wow that rhymes!   Menu was pretty good full of plenty of choices, we both opted for a lunch special, I went with the Sushi/i #1 which had 3 pieces of nigiri and a 4 pc california roll. I added a philly roll too. My friend went with the box lunch of fried aji and kara-age.   First was a bowl of miso soup. I love good miso soup, but this wasn't it. Not bad, but tasted a bit bland and generic.   The food was good, the fish very fresh, but again nothing out of this world good. Just very average place. My friend who is more into sushi than I am, said the same thing, and he liked ta-tas or I Love Sushi more. So I will try those places out next time.   Wish this could have been more, based on previous reviews. I guess I will have to try some of their specialty rolls. I will try it again in the future.
Enjoyed the sushi bar. Prices are reasonable. The seaweed and fish tasted fresh. Tried Spicy Tuna Roll, California Roll, and Vegetable Tempura. I would try again if in the neighborhood.

Every once in a while I have an intense craving for sushi, not a "time of the month" kinda thing, but a craving that leaves images and scents and flavors of sashimi, nigiri, and rolls completely polluting my mind. Now its a real pet peeve of mine when people consider themselves a self pro-claimed "Sushi Connoisseur." "Dahling, I've been to all the finest places and have had the finest, freshest fish!!" Turns out they've been to I Love Sushi twice and they became an expert on raw fish with a damn California Roll. Aside from my digression, I'm not an expert, but I know what I want and how I want it. That being said, this review is biased (but I guess you could say that about them all).    First time here, my friend and I missed the $1 off specials by a few minutes, but I was alright with that because we were there for a good time. I always order a garlic tuna and fatty tuna first as my "appetizer." Yes, did those tunas appetize me! I've noticed many sushi restaurants have their own rendition of garlic tuna, usually just soaked in garlic ponzu, but this had a thin smear of wasabi and was actually topped with minced garlic. My mouth is watering as I type this, but I still would prefer the simple soaked in garlic ponzu... (I've had too much change these past months.. So maybe I'll adjust). And of course the fatty tuna melted its omega-3s far too quickly once it hit my tongue.. It's a love-hate kinda thing.   We shared 3 rolls: dynamite, volcano, and tiger eye. We enjoyed all 3, but not for their price and the fact that the selection of rolls seem to have the same innards but are spruced up by different fish on top and/or the sauces they are smothered in.  Food and service give this a 3.5-4/5, price knocks it down. I left satisfied, but could have easily eaten more. I think this is a fun neighborhood spot, but I prefer getting the same quality with more bang for my buck. Luckily, I have a $1 off the bill next time....
I walk in, sit down, and they already know what I want. They've never forgotten me from the past time i was here. This is customer service. Love is place.

I've been to this restaurant several times and have always been treated nicely. The food is good especially the creamy mermaid (appetizer). They're very fast in seating you and the food comes out pretty quickly. The hello kitty roll like others have said is really yummy. If you go during the lunch hour, the prices are really good for bento boxes. It's great for dates but, it's quite small for a group of more than four. The restaurant is very clean as well. Children can eat here too because they have meals that cater to them. I have nothing really bad to say about this place because overall it's a good restaurant. I'll be returning.

Best sushi and traditional Japanese restaurant we have found here in Las Vegas. Family owned and run by a husband, wife and daughter. Sushi is fresh and prepared perfectly. The chicken teriyaki was excellent as well. Even the miso soup was the best I've had since my last trip to Tokyo.
Love! I think I've found my go to casual sushi joint in the Henderson area. Rolls were fresh and tasty, service was good, and they have a fun little spin the wheel game to play after.
There are usually three employees, the sushi chef, kitchen chef and hostess/server. For such a small operation with about six tables and eight seats at the sushi bar they do a hell of a job.

I really wanted to like this place--especially since the owner/main chef is good friends with the fabulous folks at Shabu Shabu Paradise--but it was just ok.  I've had much better, tastier, and generously portioned sushi rolls & nigiri at Osaka and EN. The people are nice, though, and it's not BAD, per se.  If I lived a block away, didn't want to drive far, and was REALLY craving sushi, I'd go back. As it is, I've got such great sushi choices much closer to me that it's not worth making the few miles' drive over from Anthem.

The food is pretty good but better for a quick lunch than a nice dinner. The staff can be friendly but I have experienced them looking at me and speaking their language and laughing. When I questioned them they seemed to all of a sudden not speak English! !

Today I had lunch at this restaurant and let me tell you the idea of a $5 lunch box in today's economy, is beyond unbelievable Till you try it, the $2.75 California roll I got to eat for under $10 including tip. What a deal.  The service was closer to 6 stars the server under stood my order and was overly attentive, with all the tables full, my water was never less than 1/2 full.  This type of restaurant would normally be 4 stars at best, but Emory made it perfect and got the 5th star.

Sushi Imagine had 4 1/2 star so I tried. I'm not a fan. Lacking freshness and quality. They do have a lot of choices on lunch specials. I guess it's ok if that all you are looking for.   I had toro. Uni not fresh, (had to spit out) and Salmon.  What really throws me off is the rice. Rice was not like sushi rice. It's hard and loose. I mean if they cant get the rice right, how can they get everything else together? Totally waste of time and money.

Finally had the famed Hello Kitty roll! For those who are wondering, I am pretty sure / if memory serves, it is shrimp tempura, cucumber, and yellowtail (maybe?) wrapped in seaweed and rice, then topped with more tuna and avocado, some kind of tiny egg (not the big roe, but the grainy-looking stuff), and mayo sauce. It was pretty good, though I was not completely blown away by it.   Had the Rock N Roll, which I personally liked better than the hello kitty roll. Next time we are going to try the Hot Rock Roll.  All the specialty rolls here look so good, and I know I can trust them to not be too ricey. I'm going to have to keep going back to try new things!   Also had the jalapeno bomb appetizer - deep fried jalapenos stuffed with spicy tuna and cream cheese - definitely has a little kick to it, the slow burning kind of jalapeno spicy that you don't realize is hot until you've already eaten all 4 pieces. I definitely ended up drinking an entire glass of water trying to eat these (but I am a wimp).   We had a creamy mermaid coupon and a $1 off coupon from last time, which they had no problem using at all.   The service continues to put this place over the top. Fast and friendly, just the way I like it. When we arrived on this visit, there was an open 2-person table near the door, but they cleared a 4-person table really quickly for us in the back, as it was pretty cold outside and there was a bit of a draft. Going to have to come back soon to use my $1 off coupon! What a great marketing idea :)

I eat a lot of sushi and this little hole in the wall is one of my absolute favorites in town!  Try the hello kitty roll, jalapeno tuna, and rattle snake.  Delicious!  They have the freshest tuna I have found in the whole Las Vegas area!
